solution_01_data_basics/01_counting/05_read_frequency_distribution_v2

video

The first 4 questions involve adding up frequencies of the indicated intervals. The last 4 questions can be done by guessing and checking until something works.


  1. (ANS=30) There are 30 measurements less than 48.5. So, \(\#[\mathbf{x}<48.5]=30\).
  2. (ANS=82) There are 82 measurements more than 47.5. So, \(\#[\mathbf{x}>47.5]=82\).
  3. (ANS=27) There are 27 measurements closer than 1.25 units from 47.25. So, \(\#[|\mathbf{x}-47.25|<1.25]=27\).
  4. (ANS=49) There are 49 measurements further than 1.5 units from 48. So, \(\#[|\mathbf{x}-48|>1.5]=49\).
  5. (ANS=48) A boundary at \(b=48\) has 23 measurements less than it. So, \(\#[\mathbf{x}<48]=23\).
  6. (ANS=47.5) A boundary at \(b=47.5\) has 82 measurements more than it. So, \(\#[\mathbf{x}>47.5]=82\).
  7. (ANS=1.25) An interval with radius \(r=1.25\) around center 48.25 contains 49 measurements. So, \(\#[|\mathbf{x}-48.25|<1.25]=49\).
  8. (ANS=0.25) An interval with radius \(r=0.25\) around center 49.25 excludes 83 measurements. So, \(\#[|\mathbf{x}-49.25|>0.25]=83\).
